p: While the validity of epidemic nodes and infective links was supported, their limitations should not be ignored. Infective links assumed that connectivity remains constant over the course of an epidemic, which is unlikely [27]. While epidemic nodes detected ‘along-road’ disease clusters even if they were not independent –an advantage over classic approaches [70]–, such nodes, here assumed to be circular, may not be realistic. To improve such constructs, future studies may consider non-circular and non-Euclidean metrics, such as road segments and the road length associated with each node –here measured but only partially evaluated.
